feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Business Application Studio
feed.subtitle: SAP Business Application Studio Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: How to Create Destination for S/4HANA Public Cloud Using SAP S/4HANA Cloud Extensibility Service?
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I’m currently trying to connect our internal SAP BTP environment with an S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition system, in order to develop Fiori applications using Business Application Studio.

As I understand it, to achieve this, I need to first register the SAP S/4HANA Cloud system in our BTP global account, and then create an appropriate Destination within the subaccount.

We have successfully completed the registration of the S/4HANA Cloud system in our BTP global account. However, we are now encountering issues when trying to create the Destination.

As far as I understand, there are two approaches to create the Destination:

  1. Manually configure the Destination
  2. Use the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Extensibility service (plan: api-access) to generate the Destination automatically

We are currently trying the second approach using the Extensibility service, but we are encountering an error during the service instance creation, and thus cannot proceed.

Could you please advise on how to resolve this error, or guide us on the correct way to configure the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Extensibility service?

For your reference, I have attached images that show the current configuration details and the error message.

entry.title: Perform CRUD operation from SAP BTP BAS on Datasphere.
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

We’re working on a BAS (CAPM) application and aiming to perform full CRUD operations using data from SAP Datasphere.

While we’ve successfully implemented the read (fetch) functionality using the architecture shown below, we’re currently facing challenges with enabling create, update, and delete operations directly on Datasphere tables.

 

 

We’d really appreciate any guidance, resources, or architectural suggestions that could help us achieve this. If anyone has experience or insights on enabling write operations with Datasphere from BAS, your support would be invaluable!

 

SAP Datasphere SAP Cloud Application Programming Model  SAP Fiori Cloud  

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Adaptation project in Fiori HANA: override (onInit, onCustom, etc ) not being called/ not working
entry.content:
I have extended a Fiori HANA App in BAS with an adaptation project and I want to override the methods. 

sap.ui.define(
    [
        'sap/ui/core/mvc/ControllerExtension'
        //,'sap/ui/core/mvc/OverrideExecution'
    ],
    function (
        ControllerExtension
        //,OverrideExecution
    ) {
        'use strict';
        return ControllerExtension.extend("customer.mytimeeventsextension.CustomListReportController", {        
            override: {                
                onExit: function(){
                    debugger;
                },
                test:function(){
                    
                }
            },
            
        });
    }
);

 

{
  "changeType": "codeExt",
  "reference": "customer.mytimeeventsextension",
  "namespace": "apps/customer.mytimeeventsextension/changes/",
  "creation": "2025-10-31T10:45:14.615Z",
  "projectId": "customer.mytimeeventsextension",
  "moduleName": "customer/mytimeeventsextension/changes/coding/CustomListReportController",
  "support": {
    "generator": "@sap-ux/control-property-editor",
    "sapui5Version": "1.139.0"
  },
  "originalLanguage": "EN",
  "layer": "CUSTOMER_BASE",
  "fileType": "change",
  "fileName": "id_1761907511309_262_codeExt",
  "content": {
    "codeRef": "coding/CustomListReportController.js"
  },
  "texts": {},
  "selector": {
    "controllerName": "module:sap/fe/templates/ListReport/ListReportController.controller"
  }
}

 

{
  "fileName": "manifest",
  "layer": "CUSTOMER_BASE",
  "fileType": "appdescr_variant",
  "reference": "hcm.fio.mytimeevents1",
  "id": "customer.mytimeeventsextension",
  "namespace": "apps/hcm.fio.mytimeevents1/appVariants/customer.mytimeeventsextension/",
  "version": "0.1.0",
  "content": [
    {
      "changeType": "appdescr_ui5_addNewModelEnhanceWith",
      "content": {
        "modelId": "i18n",
        "bundleUrl": "i18n/i18n.properties",
        "supportedLocales": [
          "en","de"
        ],
        "fallbackLocale": ""
      }
    },
    {
      "changeType": "appdescr_ui5_addNewModelEnhanceWith",
      "content": {
        "modelId": "@i18n",
        "bundleUrl": "i18n/i18n.properties",
        "supportedLocales": [
          "en","de"
        ],
        "fallbackLocale": ""

    },
    {
      "changeType": "appdescr_ui5_setMinUI5Version",
      "content": {
        "minUI5Version": "1.120.23"
      }
    },
    {
      "changeType": "appdescr_app_setTitle",
      "content": {},
      "texts": {
        "i18n": "i18n/i18n.properties"
      }
    }
  ]
}

this error ist OK (the method test doesn't exist but it shows that tries to process it when the app loads)

entry.title: Preparing for SAP C_CPE? Here’s How I’m Studying Each Section Without Feeling Overwhelmed
entry.content:
Whenever I start learning something new, I like to have everything in order.
Before I even open the first tutorial, I plan what I’ll study first, what comes next, and how I’ll track it.

Recently, I started preparing for the SAP C_CPE (SAP Certified Associate - Backend Developer - SAP Cloud Application Programming Model) certification. Since this exam covers a mix of BTP architecture, SAP BAS, CAP, Side by side extensions, Cloud Foundry & Kyma Runtime  it can easily feel like too much at once. So I created a simple structure to move step by step without feeling lost.

I began with the learning about BTP, and doing hands on by following SAP Learning Journeys, creating subaccount and adding entitlements and services (It gave me a very clear understanding of BTP architecture) and then Developing appliaction using high productivity tools of SAP BAS, Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) because it’s the foundation of most topics in this certification. I’m spending around two weeks learning about CDS models, service layers and how everything connects in a CAP project. I’m following the official SAP Learning Journey https://learning.sap.com/certifications/sap-certified-associate-backend-developer-sap-cloud-programming-model and doing small hands-on exercises along the way.

My next focus is Cloud Foundry. I’ll spend about a week learning how to efficiently develop, run, and manage cloud-native applications on SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry Runtime.

After that, I’ll move to Side by side extention on BTP.  This will cover deploying  extension and integrating the app into SAP Build Work Zone.

The next stage is Developing Appliactions in Kyma Environment. I’ll take about two weeks to explore a comprehensive understanding of Kubernetes and to orchestrate the deployment of the applications in the cloud. 

Finally, I’ll study Advanced Extensions with SAP Cloud SDK for about two more weeks. These are slightly advanced topics but very useful for understanding to develop and integrate Java, JavaScript, and TypeScript extension applications for SAP solutions like SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

So in short, this will be my roadmap-

Recommended Study Sequence

Here’s the order I suggest, from foundational to more advanced :

  1. Exploring SAP Business Technology Platform 5hrs (link : https://learning.sap.com/courses/exploring-sap-business-technology-platform)
    • This gives you a broad overview of the entire platform (services, architecture, what BTP is). Good for building your base understanding.
    • So start here.
  2. Develop Full‑Stack Applications Using Productivity Tools in SAP Business Application Studio 8hrs (https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/develop-full-stack-applications-using-productivity-tools-in-sap-business-application-studio)
    • Once you know the platform, you learn the developer tooling (BAS = Business Application Studio) which is key for CAP and full-stack apps. 
    • So this is your next step.
  3. Develop Applications on SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry Runtime 4hrs(https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/developing-applications-on-sap-btp-cloud-foundry-runtime)
    • The Cloud Foundry runtime is a major runtime environment in BTP. Understanding how to build and deploy there is critical. 
  4. Build Side‑by‑Side Extensions on SAP BTP 8hrs (https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/build-side-by-side-extensions-on-sap-btp)
    • After tooling and platform basics, you dive into extension scenarios (for example side-by-side extensions of S/4HANA using CAP). This aligns closely with CAP certification topics.
  5. Developing Applications in SAP BTP, Kyma Runtime 8hrs(https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/developing-applications-in-sap-btp-kyma-runtime)
    • Kyma Runtime is more advanced (Kubernetes, microservices, event-mesh) and often sits on top of foundational knowledge. 
  6. Develop Advanced Extensions with SAP Cloud SDK 11hrs (https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/develop-advanced-extensions-with-sap-cloud-sdk)
    • This is relatively specialized/advanced (SAP Cloud SDK, perhaps custom libraries, integrations). Once you’ve mastered the fundamentals above, you go here.

By the end of this plan, I’ll go through a short revision period with mock questions and quick notes from my learning.

This structured approach keeps my study plan clear and prevents me from feeling overwhelmed.
I study for two to four hours a day which feels realistic, and the small milestones make it easier to stay consistent.

If you’re also preparing for C_CPE, it really helps to make your own sequence instead of jumping randomly between topics. The Learning Journeys are excellent resources, but having a personal roadmap makes a big difference.

 

I’d love to hear how others are preparing for this certification too.
What topics are you finding most challenging so far and how are you managing the learning.

entry.title: How to access and test an extended Fiori app created with Adaptation Project in BAS?
entry.content:
Hello Experts, good day.

I’m seeking your guidance to understand what steps I need to follow to properly access an extended Fiori app. Let me explain the context:

This week, we extended the standard app “Manage Central Purchase Contracts” using an Adaptation Project in SAP Business Application Studio (BAS).

I had previously done similar extensions using SAP Web IDE, so I assumed the process would be similar. However, I found some differences and a few doubts that I hope you can help me clarify.

After deploying the app to our system, I noticed that the transport request included the following objects, which I hadn’t seen before:

  • App Variant (LRep cross-client content)

  • LRepository cross-client content

My main question is that I don’t know where the new app is located or how to verify that the changes were applied correctly.
Do I need any specific role or authorization to access it?

I’d also like to confirm whether it’s necessary to configure a Fiori Launchpad tile or perform any additional setup to make the extended app available.
If so, where should I look or what objects should I check?

Lastly, due to client security policies, I must request and justify access to specific transactions. I already have the basic Fiori ones, but I’d like to know if there are any additional transactions I should request to complete the setup.

Apologies for the number of questions, but this is my first time extending a standard Fiori app from BAS (we usually work with Custom or Fiori Elements apps).

Thank you very much in advance for your help and guidance!

Edson Bravo.

entry.title: How can I load custom CommonHeaderFooterHelper.js file in my Project instead of resources/sap*****/
entry.content:
Hi There,

Good day !
We are working on migration project moving UI5 apps from NEO to CF.

We have some 10 odd HR apps which are copied from or built on sap.ca.scfld.md framework.

These app fail to run in Cloud Foundry with csp error, we raised a case and SAP says we need to rebuild these apps.
The file which is causing this CSP error: sap.ca.scfld.md.app.CommonHeaderFooterHelper.js

'sap/ushell/ui/footerbar/JamShareButton.js': Failed to execute 'sap/ushell/ui/footerbar/JamShareButton.js': Evaluating a string as JavaScript violates the following Content Security Policy directive because 'unsafe-eval' is not an allowed source of script: script-src * data: blob:".

The references failed to load are: (We don't use these buttons on screen)

jQuery.sap.require("sap.ushell.ui.footerbar.JamShareButton");
jQuery.sap.require("sap.ushell.ui.footerbar.JamDiscussButton");
Since rebuilding the apps from scratch is a huge effort and time taking process, as a workaround I am thing of fixing CommonHeaderFooterHelper (removing any references to un used JAM buttons)
Is there a way to reference & load the custom .js file instead from resources?

In search, all references I could find is about custom controls, which would intern extend from original. But in my case if original is loaded the app stops with CSP error.

Thank you,

Sai

entry.title: SAP BAS Cloud Foundry Login Error: Authentication failed. Please try again
entry.content:
At times we get into a situation where things seems to be strange. I would like to share one of such situation with respect to SAP BTP Business Application Studio(BAS) login to Cloud Foundry(CF) for one of the subaccount API endpoint.

Error Authentication failed. Please try again

First thing is to validate if you are using right:

  1. Cloud Foundry API endpoint
  2. Credentials or SSO
  3. Authentication method: 1) Credentials 2) SSO. If SSO then do verify either with a) Default identity provider or b) Alternate identity provider( configured by your enterprise)

If all above are all verified then do check Dev Space on BAS is running out of memory. I did create a new Dev space and CF login was resolved. 

There is a SAP note # 3533620 CF CLI in SAP Business Application Studio fails with error
"Error read/writing config: invalid character '\x00' looking for beginning of value" , however did not try it out.

entry.title: Unified Destination Setup for Accessing Multiple OData Services in BAS
entry.content:
Dear SAP Support,

I would like to ask a question regarding how to manage Destinations on SAP BTP.

So far, we have been using the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Extensibility service to create Destinations for each individual communication scenario (e.g., one for sales order integration, another for purchase order integration).
As a result, we are ending up with multiple Destinations—one per communication scenario—that correspond to each OData service we wish to use.

On the other hand, when connecting BTP with an SAP on-premise system, it has been possible to access various OData services through a single Destination.

Our current objective is to enable a development flow where we can build a Fiori application in BAS and, at the initial data source selection step, choose from various OData services (e.g., purchase, sales, or custom OData) via a single Destination.

However, as it stands, only the OData services associated with the specific communication scenario used when the Destination was created are selectable during BAS development. This limits flexibility in application development.

Is there any recommended configuration or best practice that would allow us to create a single Destination that can be used to access multiple communication scenarios or OData services?

I would greatly appreciate your guidance on this matter.

Thanks,

entry.title: The ‘Field is Required’ validation message is not appearing on the Add Notification screen.
entry.content:
I’m working on the Add Notification screen in SAP Asset Manager 2405, and I have made several fields mandatory using the RequiredFields.js rule.

The validation is working correctly — the transaction does not proceed when the field is empty — however, the “Field is Required” message is not displayed on the UI for the following control:

  • FuncLocHierarchyExtensionControl

Other required fields (such as Work Center and Reported By) show the required message correctly, but this extension control does not.

I have verified the following:

  • IsRequired = true is correctly set in the metadata.

  • The control name matches the ID added in RequiredFields.js.

  • The CheckRequiredFields action is triggered during Save.

  • The ValidationRule (NotificationCreateUpdateValidation.js) is executed.

Despite this, only the validation logic works—the required field message does not appear on the UI for this FormCell.Extension control.

 

Could you please help me understand why the “Field is Required” message does not appear for FormCell.Extension (HierarchyExtension) controls and whether there is any additional configuration or workaround required to make this work?

entry.title: How to clone a CAP based solution from one HANA Cloud Database to another?
entry.content:
Hello experts,

If you wanted to copy a CAP based solution between environments (e.g. PROD -> TEST) how would you do it?

Let's say you have a CAP based solution running productively and you want to clone that system into a test system. This solution is a stack consisting of 1+ CAP servers instances hosted in Cloud foundry and connected to a SAP HANA Cloud instance. Production and test are completely separate (Different HANA Cloud DBs).

Suppose both the production and test systems already exist and are working, they just have different data. We'd like to wipe the test system and repopulate it with data from the production system.

How do you typically do this? Specifically I'm looking for recommended procedures on how to do this please?

Options

One way that will work is using DB Explorer to export all the data for all the tables and then on the test DB import those files. The problem with this approach is it will require quite a lot of manual clicking, time and possibly slicing of data since it is not possible to export some tables in one go (as they are too large).

DB explorer also has an option for exporting catalog objects, but if I understand correctly, these exports bring data as well as all the scripts to create such objects on a target DB. If they were imported they would create a completely new schema/HDI on the target DB. If this is the case this is definitely not what we want.

Is there any other approach, please?
Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Connection error to CAP MCP servers in BAS with Cline
entry.content:
Hi there

I've attended AD160 hands-on session at TechEd in Berlin which didn't work out too well due to technical issues... meh.

So I tried to play around with the CAP MCP and the Cline extension for ourselves. For that we set up a brand new subaccount with SAB Build Code and AI Core (boosters). But we're facing some issues. What we did and what works so far:

- added Cline extension ✅
- installed npm packages gobally (@cap-js/mcp-server, @SAP-ux/fiori-mcp-server, @ui5/mcp-server) ✅
- connected Cline with SAP AI Core (same subaccount) ✅
- set global rule (with this and this) ✅

But what doesn't work at all is the connection to the MCP servers from Cline. I have this configuration but Cline says "MCP error -32000: Connection closed" ⛔

{
  "mcpServers": {
    "cds-mcp": {
      "disabled": false,
      "timeout": 60,
      "type": "stdio",
      "command": "npx",
      "args": ["-y", "@cap-js/mcp-server@latest"],
      "env": {}
    }
  }
}

When I set up the exact same in VS Code locally (with connection to SAP AI Core) it works quite well. Any ideas what the problem could be?

entry.title: Sync Fails on Manually Created Mobile Service, but Works on Auto-Created Service (SSAM 2505)
entry.content:
I am facing a syncing issue in my SAP MDK 2505 application, and I need help understanding why it behaves differently based on how the Mobile Service is created.

I have two Mobile Services:

  • Manually created Mobile Service (created directly in SAP Mobile Services cockpit)
  • Automatically created Mobile Service (generated through the backend using the Config Panel)

When I deploy my MDK 2505 application to:

  • Manually created mobile service - Sync fails
  • Auto-created mobile service - Sync works perfectly

The same app bundle, same user, same backend, and same device are used in both tests.

I verified that the App ID, App Version, roles, security settings, and Offline OData destination are identical, and I also recreated and redeployed multiple times.


My question is: why does syncing work only with the backend-generated Mobile Service but not with the manually created one? Does the auto-created service contain additional metadata or offline configuration that is not visible in the cockpit, or are there required settings in the manual service is missing?
Any guidance or checklist explaining the differences between manual and backend-created Mobile Services for offline sync would be helpful.

entry.title: Unsupported OData Version 4.01 when connecting Fiori List Report app to Sales Order API
entry.content:
Dear Community,

I’m currently working on a specific development in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud.
we are developing a Fiori app that allows users to mass change sales order items (quantity, delivery date, add new items, etc.).

For this purpose, we are using SAP Business Application Studio.
We first created a List Report application, then connected it to an OData service using the following API:
https://myxxxxxx-api.s4hana.cloud.sap/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_salesorder/srvd_a2x/sap/salesorder/0001/

However, when running the application, we receive the following error message:

“Could not open app. Please try again later. Details”

 

Could you please help me understand this behavior and guide us on how to resolve this issue?

entry.title: How to use BTP destination with OAuth2ClientCredentials in BAS Fiori app
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I have created a destination in BTP Cloud Foundry as below.

Then I create a Fiori app (Freestyle, Basic template) in BAS and choose "Add Application to Managed Application Router" in the project template.  And I have added the following highlighted part to xs-app.json file.

And add the following in ui5.yaml file. 

Other template-generated files are unchanged, like "xs-security.json". So if I use the following code to call the API endpoint via the destination, I got err "Invalid access token".

It seems that the destination doesn't auto request the access token with the configured client_id and secret. I can see other project in the same subaccount is using a CAP service to get the destination's token_url, client_id and secrete to manually request the token. Is this kind of CAP manual approach is unavoidable? can we just make the destination service to auto get the access token when redirect the API call? Please help advise. Any tips will be much appreciated.

Thanks,

Rayman

entry.title: Redirect navigation to extended “Manage Central Purchase Contracts” app
entry.content:
Hello Experts, good day.

We are facing a peculiar situation and I would like to know if anyone has any ideas on how we could resolve it.

We created an extension of the standard Manage Central Purchase Contracts app. The change was developed in SAP BAS, and the deployment was successful. We also created a target mapping and a tile to use the new extended app. Up to this point, everything works fine, and all tests ran successfully.Target Mapping Inbound Navigation

However, we encountered another issue.

We noticed that a user is working with the Process Purchase Requisitions Centrally app, which includes an option to open the Manage Central Purchase Contracts app. What we need is for this navigation to open our extended app instead of the original standard one.

The problem is that we don’t know how to achieve this.
Do we need to extend the Process Purchase Requisitions Centrally app as well?
Or is there any way to adjust the target mapping or redirect the navigation without modifying that app?

We are honestly a bit lost on how this could be done, and any guidance would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks
EBZ
